comment.author: 22081583@N06
comment._content: This photo was probably taken on Saturday 27 October 1900 after snow and rain had flooded the Tynemouth branch line. At Cullercoats station a train tried to get through the flood and was partially derailed. The passengers had to be rescued by boats that were brought to the station from the beach.

comment.author: 56458811@N06
comment._content: An impressive image indeed! [via Flickroom]

comment.author: 35031094@N05
comment._content:
I think Cullercoats station has had problems with flooding in more recent years but never this bad I don't think. 

I've also seen another shot of boats on a flooded Cullercoats Station but looking in the opposite direction towards Tynemouth. This was also from early 1900s. If anyone knows of it please post a link here if that's possible.

Everyone seems to be posing for the photographer in this shot (except the dog on the left)!
